Posts.Title: SNB with Bi-lateral Mastectomy? BonnieKJG BonnieKJG

Posts.Content: BonnieKJG wrote: After the pathology from my right-breast lumpectomy showed multi-focal ILC, and LCIS (in addition to the original IDC) - my doc is recommending bi-lateral mastectomy. I understand the increased risk now with the multi-focal lesions and LCIS makes that a prudent choice - but my question is around the SNB process. Previous mammos and MRI showed nothing in the left side (the "good" side); so how can the SNB process "find" a sentinel node?  Seeking feedback - for those of you who have done PBM - what has been your experience? Did you have the SNB done on both sides?  Thank you! Bonnie Dx 12/31/2008, IDC, 1cm, Grade 2, 3/10 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: SNB with Bi-lateral Mastectomy? BonnieKJG BonnieKJG

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2009 04:53PM BonnieKJG wrote: Hi Beth - Just had a lumpectomy + SNB last week...Since my sentinel node was positive, my doc took more nodes from the underarm area, and I did get a drain. The drain is used to draw fluid away from the surgical site when multiple nodes are removed. My understanding is that not all lumpectomies need a drain; it depends on the particulars of your situation.  If you do get a drain, make sure the nurses explain how to strip and empty it before you leave the hospital.  Best of luck to you! Bonnie
